cleaned_text: Potatoes Vegan Rosemary Mashed Potatoes are an all-time-favorite! For this recipe I used Rosemary doTERRA essential oil and it is delicious, non-toxic and extremely satisfying! Ayurveda explains that Vata season (fall-winter) carry cold, dry and rough qualities, and so, when we boil and cook our root veggies we add the moisture - element of water - that our bodies need to balance the effects of our environment. Rosemary is also known for its powerful medicinal qualities and is a great plant medicine to incorporate during this season. Rosemary essential oil supports healthy digestion and internal organ function when ingested. It can help us reduce nervous tension and occasional fatigue - which often are symptoms of high Vata. This herb is a rich source of antioxidants and anti-inflammatory compounds, which are thought to help boost the immune system and improve blood circulation, and it is high concentrated oil form enhances and penetrates deeply into our deep tissues and organs. It is also considered a cognitive stimulant and can help improve memory performance and quality. It is also known to boost alertness, intelligence, and focus! Today I wanted to share a simple and satisfying recipe for you to have on its own or pair it with your favorite compassionate plant based main dish! Servings:4-6 Prep Time:15 min Cook Time:30 min Difficulty:Easy INGREDIENTS: 4 medium Yukon gold potatoes 2 tablespoons vegan butter 2 tablespoons coconut oil 1 small red onion, chopped 2 cloves garlic, minced 2 drops Rosemary oil ½ cup oat milk Salt, to taste Pepper, to taste INSTRUCTIONS: Place potatoes in pot with enough salted water to cover. Cook 30 minutes or until tender and drain. Add butter to potatoes and set aside. Add oil, garlic, and onions to skillet and cook until tender. Mash potatoes with onion mixture, milk, Rosemary oil, and salt and pepper to taste.
